intro: Rinorea marginata, commonly known as the marginate rinorea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite leaves with serrated margins. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically purple or violet in color, often clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are usually ovate to elliptic in shape and may have a slight hairy texture. Rinorea marginata is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
